climbs.name: Step right up to the Skull

content.description: The climb originally started off a tree that is no longer there and the recent fire has left suspect rock at the base. At the time of Brad Singer's guide book this route had not had a free ascent. Climb up the initial block which is the crux and then onto the slab above.
content.location: The large buttress right before the main Skull formation, to the left of the Table Top Rock.

content.description: A left facing dihedral to the left side of the ear as the same in Jet Stream.
content.location: Between Jet Stream and Kitty Litter.

climbs.name: The Regular Guy
climbs.fa: Dave LePere, Scott Wight, Greg Hitchcock 2-00

content.description: A fun way to get to the top of the formation. The first pitch goes at 5.6 starting on a slab to a fun scramble and ends at a chain anchor. The second pitch goes at 5.8 and heads up a steeper slab to a fun arete to the top. A bolted variation begins after the first slab that goes right and meets up eventually with the original route. As of 10/19/19 the anchor is missing a hanger and the other bolt is a bit suspicious. A newer two bolt anchor is located 10 feet north. A 4th class downclimb is also available to the north through a small gap to the East Face.
content.location: The left most bolted route on the south face.

climbs.name: Kitty Litter
climbs.fa: F.A. Bob Kutch, Brian Smith  F.L. Brad Singer, Dave LePere, John Cardmon, Travis McElvany, Kenn Kenaga 1-99

content.description: Described in Hidden Treasures as a "slabmaster's delight." The crux being getting past the first bolt.
content.location: Pinnacle right of Jet Stream and Regular Route.

climbs.name: Jet Stream
climbs.fa: Bruce Rubio, Jim Kutch, Bob Kutch, Brian Smith Early 80's

content.description: Start up a slab past a few bolts, getting to the first bolt is the crux. After this follow a thin crack to the left side of a dihedral called "the ear." Climb up this to another ledge then up an easy face to the anchors.
content.location: The right side of the south face.
